reviewText: This should be called Knicks: the history of losing.This is the flip side of the Red Sox-Yankees rivalry (except the Celtics didn't BUY their championships) where the Celtics lord it over the Knicks except for 1973. The DVDs may be nice, but if the Knicks can be called a "dynasty" with only two titles between 1970-73, then why not the Bullets, or the Warriors, or the Bucks or the Rockets? In my opinion, the Rockets are on the very low borderline (because they are one of the few teams that repeated and they went to the Finals 4 times) and the Knicks fall below the Rockets.Yes the 1970 and 1973 Knicks teams were special for their team play and compelling storylines re: Reed but really the history of the Knicks consists of a lot of great First-round/EC Semifinal games with the occasional NBA Finals game. This does not make a dynasty.A better DVD idea for Knick fans is a DVD devoted to Bernard King, whose career was cut WAY TOO SHORT due to injury, and his greatest games.Other games that should be on this DVD set:-1969: Knicks (as the higher seed) lose to the AARP Celtics in the playoffs.-late 70s, early 80s: Any Knick games with Michael Ray Richardson, before his coke addiction.-1985 Draft Lottery (possibly the 3rd greatest moment in Knick history)-early 90s Bulls-Knicks, just every game where Jordan schooled a bunch of perplexed Knicks-1994 ECF Game 5, Reggie Miller scores 25 in the 3th quarter then gives a counter-choke gesture to Spike Lee.-1994 Finals Game 7: John Starks winning the Award for Finals Least Valuable Player.-1995 ECSF Game 1: Reggie Miller scores 8 in the final 16 seconds after the Knicks had a 6 point lead.-1995 ECSF Game 7: Patrick Ewing misses an easy lay-up causing Pat Riley to resign in disgust.-2005 season: Any game Larry Brown coached, just for comic relief.Feel free to add your own Knick choke-jobs to this list.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was around for the incredible New York Knick teams of the 1990s. I cannot wait to get this DVD set. My step father always joked with me about the Knicks ever getting a Dynasty DVD set because we "haven't won a ring since the 70s". I just can't wait to relive those glory days of the 90s. I remember watching the classic battles against MJ and the 1994 Eastern Conference Championship win against the Pacers on NBC. Man, sunday afternoons will never be the same.
summary: Go New York, Go New York Go!!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: * 1970 NBA Finals, Game 7 - One of the iconic moments in NBA history, as Knicks Captain Willis Reed hobbles onto the court right before tip off and inspires the Knicks to the defeat the Lakers for their first NBA title* 1984 Eastern Conference Playoffs, First Round, Game 5 - Bernard King goes shot-for-shot with Isiah Thomas and the Knicks overcome the Pistons in an epic Game 5* 1984 Eastern Conference Semifinals Game 6 - Led by Bernard King's 44 points, the Knicks beat the Celtics to force a Game 7* 1989 Eastern Conference Playoffs, First Round, Game 3 - The Knicks beat the 76ers, in overtime, to complete the sweep* 1993 Eastern Conference Finals, Game 2 - Knicks fans will always remember where they were for "The Dunk" by scrappy shooting guard John Starks, as he soared above the Bulls to throw it down.* 1994 Eastern Conference Finals, Game 7 - Patrick Ewing tips the ball in sealing New York's first Eastern Conference title in 20 years* 1999 Eastern Conference Playoffs, First Round, Game 5 - A runner by Allan Houston trickles in as time expires to give New York the win over their bitter rivals, the Miami Heat.* 1999 Eastern Conference Finals, Game 3- Madison Square Garden erupts with Larry Johnson's miraculous four- point play, securing the Knicks victory over the Pacers.
Title: N/A
